bibliomancy.intro: Bhagavad Gita bibliomancy is a divination method where you open a page or verse randomly and interpret the message from the selected verse to answer your question.

verses.text: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled in the holy land of Kurukshetra and eager to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?
verses.interpretation: This verse signals the start of a great journey and internal conflict. It advises careful consideration before any major decisions.

verses.text: Sanjaya said: O King, after observing the Pandava army arrayed in military formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher and spoke the following words.
verses.interpretation: It suggests the need for strategic planning and consultation before proceeding in any important matters.

verses.text: Sanjaya said: Seeing Arjuna full of compassion and very sorrowful, his eyes brimming with tears, Madhusudana, Krishna, spoke the following words.
verses.interpretation: This verse is about emotions and offers guidance for understanding emotional struggles and finding clarity.

verses.text: The Supreme Lord said: My dear Arjuna, how have these impurities come upon you? They are not at all befitting a man who knows the progressive values of life.
verses.interpretation: This is a call to self-reflection, pushing the querent to remove mental and emotional barriers preventing personal growth.
